review: Happy uplifting atmosphere, good food, and great drinks. Been coming to Fridays restaurants since before I could legally drink. Even though the chain has changed a little over the years the food, service and drinks have maintained their high standards. All the dishes are good from salads to steaks and the appetizers are the same with some interesting twists. Deep fried string beans, who would have thought they would be so good. You can't go wrong with any desert choice, all delicious. Now the one main thing I have ordered since before I could legally drink. The L.I.T Top-shelf. That's Long Island Icetea Top-Shelf. Don't think they call it that anymore but if you ask for it they still bring it. Mmmm Good. Great place for a good time and to help forget the stress of the day. Cheers

In true Friday's style, the staff has consistently been friendly and energetic! It is a chain restaurant, so the food is hit or miss but they always have good deals and prices. It is a fun place to dine.

Enthusiastic server! I love when I ask, "What's good on the menu?" and get an honest answer.  Stopped in for dinner after a busy day. Pretty standard menu, in line with all of the other TGI Friday's that you would find around.  Service was fairly quick and no hassle over getting salsa and chips as a "Give Me More Stripes" member!

they get 5 stars for being the best in their niche....yes.....i realize they are NOT a 5 star restaurant.....but they win for their category....no doubt. it's a really great Friday's.  We have gone here since the 1st week they opened.  I've been w/ the whole family, just my wife & I and a big group many times...and they've always done a great job.  drinks are strong, food is consistently good & the hosts/wait staff/bartenders/management have always been great. Last nite we had a GREAT waiter named JD who did a stellar job.  We were at Chili's a few blocks away and 5 of us walked out because of the absolute crappy service. JD saved the night w/ his repartee & quick service. I truly do miss the shrimp & grits though....THAT was a fantastic dish.  As always, we'll be back...but last night was Stellar. If you want a cool waiter and a great Friday's experience....ask for JD
Best Fridays in Broward. I live in plantation and would definitely go to this sawgrass one. Great staff, food drinks and the bar area beats all the other ones. I come here at least once a week.

Me thinks never again. My husband and I were in the mood for a suculent dessert, but we couldnt find any cupcake/bakery shop open in our area on Sunday afternoon. So we endedp up at TGI Fridays.. My husband ordered the brownie a la mode, and I had the salted caramel cake. What a disappointment. My cake was the size of 3 quaters. No joke! And I probably had about 2 tablespoons of ice cream to go with it. My husbands brownie was not as small, but he probably had about half a teaspoon of vanilla ice cream. We called the waiter and asked him for more ice cream, and he was nice enough to bring us a cup of ice cream and apologized. The waiter is the ONE star this place gets, everything else deserves -10 stars. My salty caramel cake tasted old and stale. My hubby's brownie wasnt as awful, but it wasnt good enough to make up for the disaster that was my dessert. The tables were greasy and dirty, and the bartender next to us kept dropping the F bomb every 30 seconds. Appearantly, the effing guy who effing came last effing weekend didnt like his effing beer and she thought it was so effing annoying, so eff that! We probably wont be going again.

The service was pretty good here and probably above average for a chain restaurant.  The food was decent and on par with what I expect from these types of restaurants.  The one drawback is that the acoustics are horrible and the when the bar area gets noisy, you can hear it in the dining room.  The Jack Daniels chicken breasts were ok although the glaze is what made the meal.  Dipping the chicken breasts in the glaze was a fantastic idea.  The server was on top of the drink refills as well as checking on us and making sure everything was ok.  One of the better chain restaurants I have eaten at for sure.
We come here every friday and it is usual very good. But today the service is not to good. I wish it would be better because we love this place.

They have $3 beers for happy hour and good service from the bar keep, which is where I sat on my 3 visits.  The food was pretty good, nothing to write home to mama about.  My beer got to the last few drags and the bar keep was filling a new glass before I had to ask.

I worked nearby, so I'd frequent here at least once a month.  I'd order to-go most of the time...walk right up to the bar and usually the friendly bartender, Carlos is there.  He's nice and helpful.  Service is pretty quick and pretty decent food and deals here.  I need to make a trip here soon ;)
Salad eaters you must try the chipotle yucatan chicken salad!!! My favorite thing to order from here. Also they have a new Oreo Dessert that is scrumptious!!! Great service and great food!

Ridiculous! !!  Happy hour only in the bar area.  NOT SURE I HAVE HEARD OF HAPPY HOUR SEGREGATION IN THE SAME BUILDING.!!  And you are not permitted to go to the bar and purchase a drink bring it to your table.  Hmmmm
Typical chain Resturant- the service is horrible- food came out cold when sent back a huge hair came back with it- I guess a little added touch

Completely awful service and food!!!!  The bartenders were throwing stuff at one another behind the bar.  The waiter only checked in on us 2 times.    French Onion Soup-  came out warm not hot.   Wedge Salad- I specifically told him I wanted the Blue Cheese Crumbles but EXTRA RANCH dressing.   Salad came with NO dressing and NO Blue Cheese crumbles.  If he would have checked on us he could have corrected it.  Nope.   We wanted dessert.  But he never came to ask!  He just brought the check. I'm sorry to say but this is the FIRST time I left a .50 tip that was it.  He never once asked how it was or anything.  Nope.

We went in today for dinner and have some of the unlimited appetizers. We get seated relatively fast. The young girl asked us if we wanted a booth in the bar. We didn't think it would be a problem. However, they had the news BLASTING on like 50. Super loud blasting!!!! We were starving so decided to stay. The waitress took about 20 minutes to get to the table. She was so bad that the table next to is had to go up to the bar and get refills and a pen for their check. I asked my boyfriend if we get served in the bar or if we had to go up to the bar for service. He was confused as well. The bartenders noticed us sitting there and looking around, but didn't say anything. We couldn't be patient so we just left... Like half an hour later without even knowing WHO our waitress was.

My girlfriend and I went to this restaurant for a double date with our good friends from college. We had the pleasure of being served by Joe c. I don't say this very often at all but I can say he was the absolute best waiter I have ever had going to any restaurant not necessarily a Fridays. We all went there to have drinks and do the unlimited appetizer specials. He was constantly checking on our table to see if we wanted any more appetizers or drinks and when we did he got them to us so quickly it was so impressive. Not only was he tentative and quick but he was also extremely polite and accommodating. He has great customer service skills and for that I even told him that he was the best waiter I have ever had going to a restaurant period. So if we all go back there again I want him to wait our table and I don't care if we have to wait a couple extra minutes just to have him seat and serve us.

What a horrible lunch we just had. 5 of us from the office went in at 11:30. The place was practicality empty. We ordered Tha app plater which came out cold and took forever. The waitresses husband or boyfriend was on a corner table just hanging out and she would go over and play with him while we waited. One diner ordered a sizzling steak and spinach  which didn't come out sizzling. All in all the food and service was terrible and not a manager to be found until we left almost two hours later. I don't expect too much when I go to these chains but this was just pure laziness and bad management
Good atmosphere not too nosy the waitress was nice she kept checking in on us the bathroom wasn't too messy and we were seated right away

Worst TGI fridays. Waited 50 minutes for cold food in a nearly empty restaurant. Complained that our food was cold and the manager was unbelievably unprofessional and rude to my grandfather. Worst food/service ever.
service here was excellent. The food was better than J Alexanders  which we had the night before and at a  third the price I would go here anytime
Avoid it at all costs!  Dated, dark, and the server, after 10 minutes never showed up.  We left the place and nobody even bothered to ask why!
So far best service/sever I have had yet in Florida. Is a casual setting but service was great. Maybe I lucked out? :)
tgif fridays is not what it use to be . the entree menu could use some new selections. cant go wrong with anything jack daniels for my rib lovers. would visit again but would stick to appetizer menu

The monotony of a chain restaurant . Went in on a promotion that they are having which is buy a burger and give 1 to a friend .Soon I was informed of the stipulations after I ordered.So here is the thing ..... You have to like them and use a code and they will randomly pick a Facebook , or Twitter friend to give it to ( you don't get to pick they do it for you ) Super sucks right ? Back to my exp...... The place has a stench to it and burger was good as your first GI Joe or Cabbage Patch  Christmas gift .  This is good for a quick bite but don't expect a great Aww moment with the food grazing your pallet.

The service was great, the buy one burger get one free is just an advertising scam, the potatoes FRIED skins where nasty, the burgers where good, see picture, the stars are only for our sever Trudeau. He really deserves 5 stars.

What happened to service? We came to meet some of my girlfriends Work buddies. We told this to the hostess who had no clue that just around the corner 5 feet away was the party we came to meet. She met. I sat at a table off to the side of the bar. Long story short. I was served with no silverware, the menu item I ordered was not as described, I'm still waiting for someone to bring my check. It could be the runner that brought my meal, the waiter that brought my sons, of the bartender that walked my daughters redo over. Still no check. Probably no tip.

If there was a way to give ZERO stars This TGI Fridays earned it! Stopped by here at 9pm on a Thursday after visiting the mall to pick up some new Adidas. Wife and I were pretty hungry and have visited other TGI's in the past.  Upon entering it was pretty busy, but no hostess. She appeared in about a minute and we asked for a booth as several were available however needed cleaned off. She did say we'd probably get faster service at the bar but when we declined she darted over and promptly started clearing off a table when another happy TGI'er employee came over and asked us if we needed help.  I said "nope" and pointed in the direction of the young lady wiping down the table. This is when this happy go lucky guy informed us that we would have to wait to be seated for "ugh like five minutes because we're letting our servers catch up". Apparently he was instructed by his manager to not seat anyone? Wtf? The booth is clean, it's within reach, we're not picky people, we just want to sit down. The manager came over and notified us that it would be a ten to fifteen minute wait - to seat us.  What a joke, don't visit this establishment. Go get a taco or a sub, hell go to the hockey bar (JP Mulligans) off Flamingo Road, we did! Great service and food.

I have to say that this is by far the worst...  Sat down and they took my simple order of chicken fingers fries and a soup..  30 minutes later and no food.  Finally the manager came out with an excuse not knowing that I had already seen the customers that came in behind us were already eating.. To make things worst he offered 20 percent off the Che K and only took off 56 cents...  Let's just say I ate my last lunch out of this place..

I don't frequent this joint often because I like food with flavor. I ordered a simple BLT with avocado. My order delivered; but I received a total of eight and french fries. I guess I should've said I wanted to at least have 20 to 30 Fries...  I was in a bit of a rush with the rest of my colleagues and the waitress was moving at a snails pace. It wasn't the worst but it's certainly was not the best.

Hubby and I came here yesterday for drinks and food before the hockey game.  We sat at the bar, Hubby ordered a draft beer and I asked the male bartender for something fruity. He suggested the "watermelon cooler".  It was fabulous!  Light, refreshing, and had real bits of watermelon in it!   We decided on sharing some appetizers so we got the variety: buffalo siracha tenders, pretzel sticks and potato skins.  Then a side of French fries.  Then the waiting began!  We waited and waited and waited.  I couldn't believe how long it took and the restaurant wasn't that busy.  It was 5:15pm on a Saturday! Our food finally came out 25 mins later and the potato skins were over cooked.  Pretzels were very greasy.  We didn't get the beer cheese dipping sauce for the pretzels, so I had to request it.   Didn't have time to send it back for recooking.  What really bothered me was other customers that sat at the bar much later than us, received their food a few minutes after us. So obviously there was problems in the kitchen.   Watermelon Cocktail/Bartender Service - 5 stars Kitchen being slow/over cooked greasy food - 1 star Overall Total - 3 Stars

We arrived at Friday's around 5:20 PM on a Saturday for a pre-hockey game dinner, and had a really good meal. Our meal wasn't awe-inspiring, but it was satisfying and we all left happy. I'd like to give it 3.5 stars.  When you go to Fridays, you are expecting: 1) a meal consistent with ones you've had at Friday's before; 2) American food that is well seasoned and well cooked; and 3) a lively atmosphere. We got all of those last night. I was happy since I hadn't been to Friday's in a couple of years and didn't know if the quality had declined as restaurant trends have shifted.  Pros of eating here tonight: - Greeted and seated right away; - Decent happy hour drinks menu, $3-$6 (of course, we wanted some specialty drinks instead, but they weren't terribly priced at $7.50); - Food came out in about 20 minutes. The order was correct. Everything was hot. The food was cooked correctly and reflected their descriptions on the menu; - We had great service. The waitress was quick, attentive at just the right times and amount, came by to check if all was ok and to see if refills were needed, and took care of the check without any delay.  We all enjoyed our meals. Two of us had the Jack Daniels grilled chicken sandwich. It was good! I really liked the onion crispies on top, and the Jack Daniels relish/saucy stuff that came on the side. My dad liked his French dip a lot. My sister liked her hot spinach dip, but I thought it was a tad bland.  I will return to this Friday's again, and it won't take a few years.  They have a diverse and well priced menu, and our food was good.

Why does this place always smell like a toilet? Food is okay. Drinks are on point. Bartender, 'specifically dude with black curly hair is cool. But it always smells like a toilet. And it really kills the vibe. Also, why do they hire children? Get some older gals in there! People with experience an attitude! Maybe ladies with a kid and douche husband kinda probs. Makes the experience a little more enjoyable. Love me a sassy attitude. I want my highball glass being manhandled like they mean it. These kids don't know what they're doing. They just look at you like a deer in headlights and repeat what they're managers tell them. BORING.

I'm here now and not happy. Sitting at the bar at 6pm--it's half full, two bartenders and they can't keep up. They leave you empty and with dirty dishes. They lost at least $50 at this end of the bar due to inattention to the customer. I live around the corner but I won't be back.

I will never go back to this thi friday ever again the server was rude and the people at the bar were roudy and they wouldn't quiet them down the manager came over and was super rude told me that i could move tables or leave i left but i will be calling corporate tomorrow morning and telling them how displeased i am.
Slow service rude bartender inexperienced staff very few happy hour choices . don't bother

When my office goes out to lunch or for a drink after work, Friday's is close and convenient.  I really wish they would pick somewhere else. I've tried quite a few menu options, and while the burgers are the best thing I've had, their burgers really aren't anything amazing.  My last visit looking at the drink menu it says (ask about our local and craft beers), so I did. The server proceeds to name bud light, Heineken, Guinness. I gave him a puzzled look and repeated myself and he repeated himself........ I showed him the menu and he said he's not sure he'll go ask the bar. He came back 3 minutes later and said they don't have any. So I ordered a Guinness.  Friday's is not what it used to be. Not even their potato skins are near as good as what they once were.

Extremely slow kitchen and terrible hostess with wierd attitude.  Should have gone to chili's restaurant. I was trying to give this place a second chance the first time it took seriously an hour and twenty minutes for food to arrive.  How does this establishment stay in business with out corporate stepping in

Horrible in every way. If a zero was possible I would leave it. Work lunch with 9 people. Called ahead to reserve table. Arrived at 10 past 1. Sat down in 5 min. Drinks in 10min. Getting someone to come take our order took 20min from sitting down. Our orders arrived separately over a 10min span 30-40min after ordering. Some was hot and some had cold food and stale bread.  All the while no communication from any of the staff as to what the issues were. Waitress got the manager to take a whole 20% off the bill.

Just what you'd expect from Friday's. Mediocre, cheap priced food. The drinks also are a good price so you won't break the bank. Food was hot but dry. Service was good and things came out quickly and we'll timed. Wasn't that crowded and convenient to hotel. Open late for the night owls.

I was struggling on whether not to rate a one instead of a two. I was also leaning towards a 0. As soon as my friends and I entered Friday's, the host brought us past many empty booths. After passing what may have been about ten booths we finally arrived at a hard five top table. Mind you, we are three people. Three. Not five. Not even four. Three. That's not the only horrible part. (Oh it gets worse) This table was right next to a table of 20-25. A loud party of 20-25. It was right next to a drink station where the serves would go to get drinks for the ENTIRE restaurant. Not only that, this table was right next to.. THE RESTROOMS. Why in a room full of such few people, they would sit us there? I'm still trying to figure out the answer.  Now, Alberto was our server. He was very nice after taking our order and getting our drinks. However, once he came back to bring us some lemons, he passed gas. Right next to my face. Did he apologize? This young man didn't even acknowledge what he did to us. On top of that, ten minutes went by.. Then 15... Then 20... And there was still no sight of our food or Alberto. Alberto finally comes back after a half an hour later. No food in his hands. "I'm sorry, there's been a situation with the chicken. It'll be out soon, okay?" Okay Alberto. What choice do I have? His manager came back with a small plate of chips and salsa. How sweet. She must have known we were hungry. The chips were gone before they even got there. Our food came out and it was pretty good. However, my friend could tell her food was sitting under the heating light for a bit too long. After waiting for that food for ages, it was so disappointing for her to wait for something that was not up to par. No one should have to experience this anywhere. Especially at an EMPTY restaurant. I hope Alberto and the rest of the Friday's staff can get their act together.
Smallest portions ever! Cant believe the size of those ribs, pure bones, chicken bourbon was like an appetizer... TGI !!! What are you doing?

Second time coming to this location and unfortunately I didn't learn after the first visit and came back a second time and got food poisoning. I literally have lived in the bathroom all day today after eating a burger there last night and I had the same experience the first time after eating a few appetizers. So something is obviously going on in the kitchen &. needs to be addressed but I will be making a complaint on Fridays website. I honestly just need to stop eating out and cooking my own food . lesson learned !!! I will say the jack Daniels sauce is awesome lol that's the best thing ever but feeling this way sucks. AND I HAVE BEEN TO DIFFERENT LOCATIONS AND NEVER EXPERIENCED THIS SO ITS THIS LOCATION !!! BEWARE!!!

This location has really gone down hill. Friday's isn't keeping up with the other chains in this category. The food isn't good anymore. Applebee's has better bar bites and small plates that you can mix up. I used to hate Applebee's but sadly their food is better now.

I don't know why I come here every now and then. I guess I'm just delusional, stubborn and hungry so I think I'm gonna have a good bite and I'm probably sick of chilis to be honest since its in the same area. The only thing I order here and am happy with is their burgers. Their Mac and cheese: horrible and dry. Their seafood: tiny and burnt (looking at you lobster tail) Their chicken with bread crumbs: wanted to cry. Their drinks: wayyy too sweet AND IS IT JUST ME OR ARE THE PORTIONS SMALL AS HELL?! Seriously only giving two stars because of their friendly staff and their burgers. Other than that, you would gets nada.

15 minutes after we order the waiter told us that they rant out of ribs, ok we order something else, i order a bud light and the glass was greasy and smelly, i asked the waiter for a bottleled beer and took 15 more minutes and two reminders to finally get it, on top of that they mess with the order and brought a completely different dish, stay away from this place.

Blair is an amazing bartender. When I was indecisive on what I wanted to eat she offered detailed information on the menu items and her own personal recommendations. I went with her recommendations and was over-satisfied with the food. Her drink recommendations are also great.  The quality of the food I ordered exceeded any of my previous visits here. It was served very quickly, still hot, fresh and very tasty.  The restrooms were very clean and fully stocked. The restaurant was also clean everywhere I looked around. TGI Fridays is definitely a great place to go... I love that they get better every time you go. Seems like, at this location, the strive on how they can be better each time and really WOW the customers. Impressed! I will be back!

Very bad service . We walk in and there was no menu when the place only half full. We sat down, got our drinks on time, then we ordered our food. Then we got our appetizer but could not eat it because there was no silverware. When we asked why there was no silverware the server  said that they were too busy. By the time we got the silverware the app was cold. We waited for our main course for about 40 mins and we only got one meal out of three. The food was great as usual, but service was terrible. The restaurant manager does not even care. Will not go back to this location.
Our food was horrible, my Chicken Nachos were sparce with chicken, cold and not good. Service is very slow and some really loudvmusic. We're not coming back

This establishment has a 2.5 star rating. If I was in charge I would tackle this reputation by working with team members to create a sense of urgency when it comes to taking care of customers. There is a level of apathy that is tolerated by management and that is why the store is rated so poorly. The bar is a key cog in the wheel but in this store there is such a laissez faire attitude. Time is not of the essence. The bartenders are present but far from that state. They are not responsive to their servers and slow down service. The manager is visible but he isn't managing. Things need to change and soon. Get it together because you have potential.

I dine at this location frequently. The service is very good and the food is always timely and well prepared. My favorite bartender is Kimberly. She is always kind and attentive. Offers great suggestions. Fridays is lucky to have someone like her to represent customer service as it should be. Look for her if you visit this location, you won't be disappointed. Her picture is attached.

The ceiling is dripping on me because of the AC. No one cares. Waitress ignored our complaints. Manager turned off the ac in our area, now it's hot. Been here a half hour and no one has asked me if I want another beer. GET IT TOGETHER!!

Only because in was Christmas night and nothing else was open except Dennys and I hop, we decided to goto Fridays. It wasn't bad but just blah,  wait staff overwhelmed, managers running around, appetizers late to table, asked for cheese for kids pasta5 times, waitress couldn't make change for a 100 dollar bill. Next Christmas, we will go to I Hop.

came in with friends to eat, was sooooo disappointed!!   sat down right away, there was only a few tables  seated  it was like 10:30, took about 15 minutes before waitress came over, Sabrina, ordered drnks,  they took like 20-25 min before we got,  then we ordered appetizers and dinner and  I told her I didn't want food and appetizer at the same time she said ok,   well we waited for an hour for our appetizers!!!!  an hour  for some fried food  really!!!  then we said , if apps took an hour how long is food gonna be  she said oh I put in same time food will be right out or do you want me want me to hold in window, we said no please bring it so its not cold,  she ok ill be back in 2 minutes,  well  we ate all of our appetizers, finished our drinks, and food still not here (it was about 20-25 minutes),  we look over and Sabrina is sitting at a table in the back on her cell phone texting or something,   she looks over and sees my husband and he waves and she runs over , we tell her we need new drinks and food please!!,  she says coming , runs to back doesn't come back for almost ten minutes,  she starts bringing food out,  everyone else gets there plates  mine is another 10 minutes,  what in the world was going on  I don't know!!!,  Sabrina doesn't come back with drinks until we are almost done (alcoholic beverages)  that by this point we all just wanted to go home,  we didn't finish the drinks because we were tired and just wanted to leave, so we left  and wasted money!!   very very disappointed in how we were treated!   do not recommend this place

So obviously the days of checking what events are inn your area long gone!  Just left the comedy show at BB&T and decided to order two dinners to go.  Showed up at 11 and just missed the line forming at the door!  They automatically went on a 20 minute wait time.  Surprise surprise!  So while the to go orders were being made I ordered a French onion soup...25 minutes for the soup!  Now my warm to go order odd cold and my soup came out room temperature!  Requested to have it nuked...returned to table...the thickest, saltiest soup I've ever had..!  This location needs some basic operations retaining!

I'm not sure if they're understaffed or have incompetent cooks, but I waited over an hour for mozzarella sticks and Mac 'n Cheese. And the bowl wasn't enough for a 4 year old. I was also in a table with 12 other people. They also waited over an hour for some appetizers. I don't understand why even have these promotions if you don't have staff to accommodate. I like TGI, but stay away from this one.

Our server never checked on us, over charged us for kids drinks which were part of the kids meal, never delivered for 20 minutes one drink, never smiled, and when we asked for something left before we finished asking for what we needed. Will never go back to this one.

Food was a little slow coming out, but the service staff were exceptional. It is nearly impossible to provide a perfect service 100% of the time. This particular restaurant compensated for the slow food service and made the night enjoyable through their leadership the atmosphere remained positive and professionalism.

I wish we could give zero starts. THIS IS A TERRIBLE LOCATION!!!! I've never had such a bad experience in a restaurant before. The waiter was THE RUDEST person I've ever had the displeasure of meeting. We were celebrating my mother 59th birthday, since the second the waiter approached our table she has a mean look in her face. My mom asked her to take a picture and she took the phone frowning. Then we were one menu short and asked her if she could please bring one and she stored off with an attitude. We were celebrating a birthday and decided she was probably having a bad day and we wouldn't stress it. Then My 32 year brother asked for a beer and she ID him with an attitude, then I ordered a drink for my mom and she demanded an ID from my mom as well (she's 59!!!). At this point we were all annoyed already because her attitude was just almost unbearable and I didn't want to deal with her attitude so I didn't order an alcoholic drink, but changed my mind when she returned. She immediately stopped me and said she was not going to serve me and she had already informed the manager about our table because I had a fake ID. Mind you I'm 24 and I had NOT even shown her my ID once. We asked to speak with the manager and he was almost as terrible as her. He did nothing except tell us if we wanted to leave we didn't have to pay for what we had ordered, which was nothing but 2 alcoholic drinks and a lemonade. He didn't apologize for her behavior, offer to have another waiter help us. Nothing. We were embarrassed and extremely upset! We've never experienced such terrible customer service before. This left a nasty impression and we will NOT be returning to any TGIF. Real shame.

This is absurd! I am 23 years old, I can drink alcoholic beverages around the U.S. with no problem! And I come to TGI Friday's and I can't drink because my license is not sideways! So basically I need to pay to get a new license to be able to drink in TGI Fridays, mean while I don't have any problem in any other place even night clubs or bars, which are supposed to be more strict! Never again to this place.
Bean burger & strawberry fields salad w grilled salad. The bean burger was good. The salad was warm & blah. Not up to par by far. Wouldn't come back here even though the staff was friendly.

Had a horrible experience. Because my completely valid, scannable ID was vertical and not horizontal, I was DENIED alcohol. I am 23 years old and this is ridiculous. Completely ruined my night cap and dinner with my husband. If this is even legal and is corporate wide, it should be forewarned and there should be signs at the entrance with this so called protocol. If I could I would have given NO stars to this horrible establishment.

This TGI Fridays still has really cold air.  Stopped in after 11pm on a Wednesday night.  Sat at the bar and they were a little slammed.  Still got quick service and a beer within 3 or 4 minutes.  There is a bartender here named Fuzzy who is the absolute best.  He is friendly, knowledgeable, and above all fast.  Thanks Fuzzy!!!! I have been here many times before.  Usually service at the bar is the best service.   I love that they have the endless apps for $10.  We usually come in a group, pick 3 apps and all you can eat for $30.  Always leave full.

First let me state that Friday's used to be my favorite restaurant in the entire world... I asked to come here on my birthday every year and I look at it as a restaurant I enjoyed as a child. I am 24 years old now and just visited my ex favorite restaurant for the final time. I brought my 21 year old girlfriend who has never been there before and was excited about the cup of dirt and endless apps. She tried to order an alcoholic beverage and was told by the server that because her ID was not sideways, she could not enjoy her right as an adult to purchase an adult beverage. Upon politely speaking to the manager he assured me that this is a corporate policy and understood our frustration. This is unbelievable and Friday's will continue to lose business from every day customers as well as lifelong ones like myself. Will not be back.

They take forever on the food not too organize.  We had a party of 10 but the waitress took forever with the food.  We order apps and drinks are drinks came after our meal our runner was taking our order instead of our waitress.  Bad service

3 strikes and you're out. Third time visiting this place, will not be a fourth. Nonsense of urgency, notified the restaurant days ahead that we would be arriving around 10:30pm with a group of 20. We arrived at 10:45 and tables were not set. Waited 15 minutes to be seated. As not to cover every detail, the first drink and appetizer came out an hour later. Not sure why as restaurant was empty! I previously visited this location and walked out for the same reason, long wait time. The only positive was the young Short Spanish kid who was concerned and attempted to correct the issues. STAY AWAY, management has no clue.

We have decided to write TGI Fridays off our list with good reason.Its always the same thing lack of or non existent service. We had  been seated in a corner and 2 of the tables next to us were a mess not just for a moment but for almost 30 minutes after we had to stare them. We finally got to order our Apps that they now advertise at unlimited apps @10.00 per person.. The first set came out quick as had our drinks but they messed our app order up..No biggie they made up for it. After those were done we wanted more and also refills on our beverages but didn't see anybody for almost minutes. We had asked for a manager and THEN the waitress came asking if we wanted refills etc.  By then we lost our appetite Thankfully the manager finally came over. After we explained the situation he cancelled our bill for the apps and our beverages. He gave us a card for a future visit that we might not use. Mind you the place was not busy as most of the tables were empty. This is also not the first time this has happened at a Fridays..    .   .

I grew up enjoying visits to TGIF back in New York, but at some point I lost interest in this chain. I've been to this establishment twice now and neither experience was great.  I was here back in the late fall and again this month. The service was one of the biggest issues and food taking a long while to come out.  By the way, I usually rarely ever dine out at peak times. My mom and I stopped in here for a late lunch (3 or 4 PM) about two weeks ago, it took about 10-12 minutes to even place our drink orders.  The food was very slow coming out too.  It took quite sometime to get the check.  The issues were quite similar when I visited last fall too.  I am not health food obsessed, but this cuisine here tastes like fast food to me.  I think they put too much salt in the food and some of it is too greasy.  I did have the dessert here, it was a brownie sundae sized for one and that was good. I will probably try to avoid this particular location in the future, but then again this isn't one of my favorite restaurants these days.

Today at 4:45PM, went to get dinner, place was empty, I waited 20 minutes for table.  The wife ordered drink, sorry honey but she is 69 years old and had to show ID, give me a break. The food we ordered wasn't great, had better in other restaurants in our area.  I can tell you it's been over decade that I have walked into Friday's, and it will be another decade. When I used to go Friday's they were great, they Brunch on Sundays, calendar they sold for the year with free deserts, appetizers has each month passed.  I guess those days are gone, I remember they had points system when you ate, and wouldn't you know it when I hit 90,000 points, they ended it.  They were nice enough to use it on food, instead of items. Well like I said there is others place it spend money. The one thing I remember the most about Friday, it's loud inside, and that hasn't changed.   I can see what the elder don't like about them wearing hearing aids that blast noise in your ear.
3 of us we each ordered a burger. The place wasn't busy stopped about 12:30 on a weekday ...good thing I wasn't at lunch from work I would've been late getting back !!!

Horrible! Took 20 minutes to be seated. Then another 30 for an appetizer which we asked to be rushed as we had an infant with us and they had every excuse in the book as to why it toom so long. The chicken tasted like rubber. The bill was wrong. Took over an hour to get out of there and the place was empty! Never again.

Only thing that was ok was the French onion soup  the fish and fries were so bland, had no flavor at all. Wife said same thing about the French dip, was very bland. Service wasn't good at all, never around, won't be coming back here again.
Absolutely horrendous service!   Last time I will come here!  Waited 45 minutes for a salad.  Service looked to be dreadful for everyone else.

I haven't been to a Fridays for years when I lived in another state. It's easy to pass by this place because they have no sign on the street. What brought us in is the advertisement for the ribs at $12.99. We were greeted by the door being opened for us by the manager as we approached. Seated immediately and our waiter came right over. Very helpful and accommodating. We both had the ribs with our choice of two sides and our son had the fried shrimp. The food came out fast and hot. The waiter could not have been nicer. Reading past reviews I think there have been some positive changes as a result of past criticisms. Give it a second chance, if you see the big Sam's Club sign - Fridays is just before it. They really need a sign on the street!

What a great way to stop by and have a bite to eat and drink before the panthers game! Ever since they redid this location, I enjoy coming here. The staff are pretty friendly, and service is not too bad. My boyfriend and I decided to go to the bar and sit. I'm glad we chose to do that, because service was great. The bartender understood we were trying to have a quick bite before the game. We shared a couple appetizers since we weren't too hungry. Best decision in getting boneless chicken wings and their spinach flatbread off their happy hour menu. They were good enough portions shared to fill us up, along with the drinks we had. I tried their strawberry margarita that so happened to be only three dollars Monday night! I was very pleased with my drink. My boyfriend tried their mojito that was also on the happy hour special of the day. Couldn't beat the prices and hospitality that we were given! Definitely a good place to go to before the panthers games from now on. Conveniently close by the stadium, and overall an enjoyable experience to dine in at.
Value meal of full rack rib at $12.9. the rib is dry and burnt. Worst ribs that I ever have.
